ygData.subject: Re: [archive-crawler] suspecting regression due to [#HER-1109]
ygData.msgSnippet: Though I haven t been able to reproduce, I do see a bug in RecordingOutputStream s mark/reset support that looks like it could cause this problem. The fix is

Though I haven't been able to reproduce, I do see a bug in 
RecordingOutputStream's mark/reset support that looks like it could 
cause this problem. The fix is committed to SVN, if you'd like to try on 
your end.

- Gordon @ IA

Gordon Mohr wrote:
> I've tried to reproduce this against the site which originally motivated 
> the fix -- a site that was using 'chunked' even when responding to an 
> HTTP/1.0 request, against the HTTP/1.1 spec. However, that site has 
> changed its behavior since -- so I can neither verify the fix nor 
> reproduce the problem.
> 
> Similarly, while I see the site in your example giving 'chunked' 
> responses for Firefox visits, from Heritrix I only get regular responses 
> (and thus no hint of the problem you're reporting).
> 
> This possibility of ARC corruption is very serious and I'd like to be 
> able to reproduce and fix, so more details on how you're crawling would 
> be most helpful. You can also add comments to [#HER-1109].
> 
> - Gordon @ IA
> 
> Gordon Mohr wrote:
>> Thanks for the report.
>>
>> By any chance are you crawling in a manner especially likely to 
>> encounter 'chunked' content -- for example do you change the request's 
>> declared version to 'HTTP/1.1'?
>>
>> - Gordon @ IA
>>
>> pandae667 wrote:
>>> Dear IA-Team,
>>>
>>> since updating my source branch to include (among many other things)
>>> the proposed fix for [#HER-1109] I'm getting lots of broken ARC files.
>>> To be more exact, its not the ARC file being broken, but the content
>>> in the ARC file.
>>>
>>> Thy symphtom seems to always be the same. The real HTTP response
>>> header is mingled with some non-related HTTP header snippets. Those
>>> non-related snippet so far ALWAYS contained "Transfer-Encoding:
>>> chunked" - this is why I'm suspecting [#HER-1109] to be the cause.
>>>
>>> This so far had two different noticable results:
>>>   - I were able to read the ARCRecord, parse HTTP-Headers but ended up
>>> with some unrelated HTTP-Header stuff in the content (due to
>>> additional linebreaks from unrelated HTTP-header)
>>>   - I ended up with an IndexOutOfBoundsException while reading the
>>> ARCRecord ( ARCRecord.read(ARCRecord.java:410) - I think this reader
>>> is still from heritrix 1.8.0 release )
>>>
>>>
>>> Here is a (truncated by me at the end) example record:
>>>
>>> http://www.barke-immobilien.de/index.php?titel=impressum&PHPSESSID=a4b9005c39179754329e4fefeeb1f89e
>>> 81.209.184.140 20070412090240 text/html 4651
>>> HTTP/1.1 200 OK^M
>>> Date: Thu, 12 Apr 2007 08:58:45 GMT^M
>>> Server: Apache^M
>>> X-Powered-By: PHP/5.2.1^M
>>> X-UD-Host: webspace.udag.de^M
>>> X-UD-Method: baukasten^M
>>> X-UD-Target: ^M
>>> Connection: close^M
>>> Transfer-Encoding: chunked^M
>>> Content-Type: text/html^M
>>> ^M
>>> 3Thu, 19 Nov 1981 08:52:00 GMT^M
>>> Cache-Control: no-store, no-cache, must-revalidate, post-check=0,
>>> pre-check=0^M
>>> Pragma: no-cache^M
>>> Connection: close^M
>>> Content-Type: text/html^M
>>> ^M
>>> <!DOCTYPE html PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD XHTML 1.0 Strict//EN"^M
>>>  "http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/Strict.dtd">^M
>>> <html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xml:lang="de" lang="de">^M
>>> <head>^M
>>> <meta http-equiv="content-type" content="text/html;
>>> charset=ISO-8859-1" />^M
>>> <meta name="keywords" content="Immobilien, Vermietungen, Verkauf,
>>> H�user, Wohnung, Wohnungen" />^M
>>> <meta name="author" content="Ulf Leis" />^M
>>> <meta name="copyright" content="Ulf Leis" />^M
>>> <meta name="organization" content="Barke Immobilien" />^M
>>> <meta name="generator" content="Scite" />^M
>>> <meta name="owner" content="Andre Barke" />^M
>>> <meta name="robots" content="all" />^M
>>> <meta name="description" content="Auf unseren Webseiten k�nnen Sie
>>> sich �ber unsere Vermietungen und Verk�ufe informieren." />^M
>>> <meta name="language" content="de" />^M
>>> <link rel="SHORTCUT ICON" href="favicon.ico" />^M
>>> <title>Barke Immobilien - impressum</title>^M
>>>
>>> I'm not yet sure if I'll be able to provide some quick steps to
>>> reproduce this problem - but maybe those infos allready help.
>>>
>>> Regards
>>>   Olaf Freyer
>>>
